description.value: Indicates why the state of the subject changed.

definition.value: The subject (ResearchSubject) is not able to take part in the ResearchStudy. Examples: subject has moved away; subject cannot drive and therefore unable to participate, etc.
The subject (ResearchSubject) is refusing to take part in the ResearchStudy. Note: Subject refusal is a synonymous term and is used in some studies.
The failure of the potential subject (ResearchSubject) of meeting one or more criteria required for participation in a trial.
The subject (ResearchSubject) has finished the planned protocol-specified treatment phase.
The subject (ResearchSubject) has finished the planned protocol-specified follow-up phase.

The subject (ResearchSubject) has experienced any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.
The subject (ResearchSubject) has revoked permission to participate in the study or one or more components of the study.
The subject (ResearchSubject) has failed to follow medical advice, take medication as directed, or adhere to a prescribed course of treatment.

valueString.value: This code is not needed in the state-change-reason CodeSystem because the NCIT code http://ncicb.nci.nih.gov/xml/owl/EVS/Thesaurus.owl#C16735 'Informed Consent' can be used instead.
